author: {'steamid': '76561197971167419', 'num_games_owned': 4131, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1667430213}
review:
It's a very early, low-budget VR shooter, and it feels like it. There's 3 proper levels, each over in less than 5 minutes, and two short narrative sequences. The shooting feels bad, enemies in the first level don't make much noise and announce themselves by pelting the back of your head with arrows. You can't move during combat, but there is a dodge button that keeps you in place. Your pistol feels underpowered, and the sword feels useless past the first level, when no enemies really come close often. You unlock other weapons after playing through the micro-campaign, but I lost interest when considering that I'd have to play those same levels again.
Just awkward overall, punctuated by the engrish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268762871', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1609412135}
review:
bought this for $1
well the stages is short (and I mean VERY short).

u can treat the mobs as non existent. just see as this game feature only 3 bosses to fight without mobs.
u got 3 weapons though, each with different fighting style.
and it worked good enough.

I have no problem with dodging that some people have trouble (u have to press left grip and sway ur head to the left or right to dodge, and believe me u need to do this alot)

see my playtime ? that's as much as u can get with 3 weapons.

well, for $1 its ok. worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034741530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1539563118}
review: Das Spiel ist wirklich gelungen, aber leider viel zu kurz. Im Easy Mode ist das Spiel in knapp 20 Minuten durch. Auch fehlt der Endless Wave Access. Seit fast 2 Jahren kein Update mehr. Was ist los?? Im jetzigen Stadium ist das Spiel keine 15 Euro wert, mehr eine Demo als ein komplettes Spiel!  Hoffe das vielleicht doch noch was passiert, dann ändere ich mein Review viellicht doch noch zu positiv. Weil imgrunde genommen eine Schande, so ein gutes Spiel verkommen zu lassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970488915', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1537149747}
review: This is more or less a tech demo that never moved beyond a few short levels or a very thin storylined game. The voice acting was pretty bad and sounded as if it was done by ESL actors due to accents. I thought  the idea was really cool, but the execution was dead in the water. It takes about 15 minutes to go through the game, and you could extend gameplay by playing through again with different weapons, but there really is not a point to. It seems to have fallen into developer abandonment as a "Coming Soon" endless mode never made it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008299258', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1534894775}
review: I got this game in a bundle, knowing nothing of it, and expecting just as much. Actually, it’s pretty good! It has some heavy anime / console game feel to it – ie, waves of badguys, each ending with giant bosses that have weak points for you to target. It’s tough; took me a few tries to beat the first and second bosses, and I still have yet to beat the finale. Graphics are good, gameplay mechanics are easy to learn and intuitive. Really rough translations/voice acting, and some odd quasi-sexy scenes in the middle, not sure what that’s all about. Hey, for the price I got it for, I can’t complain. Would recommend scooping it up when it’s on sale… it’s worth an hour or so of fun! Thumbs: UP!

author: {'steamid': '76561198410794516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1548865182}
review:
戦闘前のストーリーから始めると、うちの2m^2未満のルームスケールだと進めなくて詰む。
が、戦闘ステージから全然始めることは出来る。何だったんだアレ。

このゲームの売りはUnique dodging system だろう。それ以上でも以下でもない。
この手の「いきなりボスとエンカウント系」は、左右かしゃがむしか無かったので、戦いに新鮮感はある。

銃はトリガーおしっぱで連射になるのでやや楽。
oculus touchだと、スティック押し込みでバースト射撃。非常に押しにくい。
剣は、銃の2倍程度のダメージしかなく、密着してきた敵をほとんど捌けない。

EASYでストーリークリアは非常に容易で、武器が幾つかアンロックするが。
銃剣以外の武器が全く楽しくない。

ボウガンは驚きの爪楊枝感。これ、ボス倒せないでしょ。
ガントレットは、剣圧が無限に飛んでくれないと意味ない。逆に魔法攻撃要らない。

あと、お付きのお姉さん、もうちょっと役に立ってくれないかな....

author: {'steamid': '76561197992202586', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1521493613}
review:
I cannot recommend the game if you are interested in playing it for the story. The single player "campaign" consists of three (3!) short wave-shooter-levels and each one has a rather unbalanced boss. Also, there are two (2!) non-action-levels where you practically do just one action. 

To be perfectly honest: The game has a lot of potential. But for 15 dollars, I expect at least a little more. I mean, I've played through the entire game in 24 minutes! 24 minutes! That's not even a demo!
If the game gets expanded, I will be more than happy to pay for the game again. 

Graphics and sound are great. The story has some potential. 

I am disappointed right now but I will keep an eye on this game. Please make this into a real game, developers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1513563834}
review:
So I paid $4.49 on the Thanksgiving sale.  I think it's still too much given what's here.  This really should be like a $2.49 USD value game at the most given the current state of the game.  It's just a mess for the most part.  The game has some nice moments.  More than anything else, the game dev had ambition.  

The execution of that ambition was subpar.  The voiceacting is laughable.  English is not the first language for these voice actors.  And maybe not even their second language.  Cutscenes are not enjoyable and the trash before getting to the boss fights is just boring to have to go through.  

The boss fights are uneven.  Dodging is dodgy.  Yet dodging is important for each boss fight.  Only the basic shooting and sword swings are consistent.  Everything else is inconsistent.  The boss fights are not special.  You don't even know whether you're winning or losing.  Just a lot of repetition and persistance involved, along with luck with the dodges.  

Rating 4/10 needs to be lower priced, nobody should have to pay the normal price of $14.99 and $2.49 sounds just about right given what is there, we have to overlook several flaws to even have a little fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198058602281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1520733516}
review:
I really enjoyed this. 

Its really short so I would buy it on sale. 

It is B-E-A-U-T-I-F-U-L.     Feels like you are inside a high end anime horror with vampires.   The steam punk element is also great. 

The controls for all 3 "classes" are very good.   I especially like the steam punk fire mage/ironman.  I dont know what exactly is going on there, but I love it. 

The story is very simple but so was the original Castlevania story.  Stop the vampire because reasons. 

The dialogue was clearly put through a language filter, as the grammar does not always make complete sense.  

The gameplay is great.   I'm not a fan of the dodging mechanic.  I think it would be better to have the player block with their weapons, or maybe they hold the block button and that gives them a shield for 1 second, so they still have to get the timing right.   

I actually thought I was blocking by parrying with the sword in the first 5 minutes (I wasnt I was dodging), and it was super satisfying, but then I realized blocking with my sword wasn't doing anything.  

I am tired of wave shooters where you don't move, but the gameplay and graphics are so good, I dont mind for this game.  

I hope this gets developed further the graphics and gameplay are stunning.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974522156', 'num_games_owned': 4394, 'num_reviews': 794, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1512882406}
review:
More like Kidney Stone  - passing of blood that's how much pain this pile of shit gave me. TBF it's not that bad but it's just not much fun. Maybe ok in a Chinese arcade just another boring stand in place fighter with little imagination. 

In fact Kidney stones would be more fun than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013812373', 'num_games_owned': 1762, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1511137487}
review:
From the many ridiculous translation errors and the extremely chaotic pace of the story to the atrocious voice acting and the mindnumbingly boring gameplay, this is just another wave shooter, wrapped in something bad that will leave a sour taste in your mouth. 

It kinda shows promise - at times - but the game is ultimately nothing more than a haphazardly mashed together pile of junk that lacks any congruence. Playing this, I felt like I was trapped in some psychotic arcade hall with the volume dialed up to eleven and with no means of escape, all the while being chased by clowns with rabies. Please, stay away!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996641293', 'num_games_owned': 4770, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1512100878}
review:
This game is definitely flawed. The balance is a mess. Enemies can spawn in all directions, and there is not enough indication as to where they are attacking from. The dodge mechanic is unwieldy. The final boss involves keeping track of too many things simultaneously.

I criticize because I am excited to see what comes next. The only way I can describe fighting a giant skeleton monster in VR was epic. I felt like an action hero by the end. This game makes me excited for the future of VR when the games have a bit more polish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974144576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1599173275}
review: boss guys to hard i quit

author: {'steamid': '76561198257293417', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1508986865}
review:
I can see potential for this game, but unfortunatly I cannot recommend it in its current state. If you want to try it out WAIT FOR A SALE!

Pros:

- Music is original and fitting for the mood of the game
- Graphics and settings are nice

Cons:

- The pacing of the game made it near impossible for me to understand what was going on, it was basically one boss after another with one or two lines of dialouge about events that are never explained in between
- The dodging system, in VR it's instinctive to try to dodge attacks by physically moving your body. For me it was really immersion breaking to dodge by holding the grip (only on the LEFT CONTROLLER) and shaking my head.
- The voice acting, I can't say it's the worst I've ever heard, but it's pretty bad (granted the script they have to work with is really weak)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030519086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1488064293}
review:
Worth a punt if its on sale and you're not sick of wave shooters yet.  Theres only really 3 short combat levels and a couple of scenes of banter between the two characters so the content is fairly limited - though I believe the Devs are still adding a couple more things to the game.  The voice acting is so-so, tbh i'm fond of bad dubbing so hearing the main gal talking about getting a weeee-pon (weapon?!) kinda cracked me up :)  The wave shooter bits are fairly average but the boss fights are quite exciting, the dodge system adds a bit to the mechanics and the main vampiric bad guy coulda been ripped straight out of Symphony of the Night :D  Overall an above average game - not great but definitely not bad, again if you can get it cheap enough.

TLDR:  After the first proper level you can go under the bed and clip up to try to get a look at some fine topless tittah's!  Look close enough and you'll realise you've been caught out as a weirdo japanese perv :D  11/10 would get caught fapping again ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198078054410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1487101985}
review: It was a fun game but for 15 bucks I expected more levels I beat the game in almost 30 minutes and end game content did not look fun to me

author: {'steamid': '76561198105177952', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1487056706}
review:
这是一款现今我个人认为值得买的VR游戏。游戏中的多种武器系统都非常有趣。游戏好像要说了一个吸血鬼的故事，事实上是三关的战斗，不过这三关的战斗体验感很棒（让我对VR动作类游戏有了好感）。游戏内的难度有明确的分级，对于喜欢动作游戏的玩家来说是很有趣的事。（就像怪物猎人里打同样的怪物，但每次都有不同的感受）
游戏不错，物超所值。不过我还是希望以后能有更多的怪物战斗内容。
Its definitely a VR game worth playing once. The weapon system is attractive and I can say never seen before.
Though there are not too many stages(three in total),  its fun to play several times and with the growing difficulty i feel challenging in the combat.
Hope for more varieties of enermy and more stages in future updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030776690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1486821545}
review: I should have heeded the negative reviews on this one.  I got this game after the "imporved" dodge system.  I can only image how bad it was before.  Here is a suggestion to the developers for a dodge system. It is VR! You could actually dodge!  It doesn't have to be a arbitrary controller button/gesture combo like they have here.  Honestly, check out a game like Vanishing Realms to see how it is done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324070191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1485231534}
review:
Waiting for some while till the upgrade and price adjustment. Few comments on the game
- Very good quality in graphics among the VR games
- Quite interesting the way of game play (Creative in VR game)
- New experience in VR FPS+Action. It's like Dark Soul in VR via the Boss battles.
- NPC is hot but lack of intereactive with players
- Story seems great but lack of fully introduction
- BGM is great according with the whole atmosphere
- Overall As of an Indie small team, applaud for the continuous improvement and high quality!

author: {'steamid': '76561198319660630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1485184375}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974765747', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 362, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1512452821}
review:
My specs: GTX 1070/FX8320/16 Gigs RAM


This is a great game. Yes, great and worth the money because it is well done overall in VR. It has sexy characters, active game play, bosses, small story and some adventure aspects. And yes at first it may seem very confusing and "in your face" but after playing a few times you will get the hang of it and then you can start to appreciate it. Be prepard to get physically active. The game runs well on my modest specs. Don't let any negative reviews keep you from trying it out. I want more content for this title and I hope it gets the support. We need to support titles that want to do things differently. Have fun !!!

Some gameplay video below at 60fps so it may be slow playing through Steam or if your internet is slow. If it is just go to 720p or just go to my page. Enjoy.

https://youtu.be/aZW0SmAomCk

Vampire boss battle and end credits but still did not kill him. He ran again.  :-)

https://youtu.be/EmKBuTFGMMo

author: {'steamid': '76561198298074343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1481393458}
review: I really like this game, it just needs a simple dodge tweek. But unfortunately this game is not getting any support. As the feedback is all the same. And no changes made. The dodge system is too much. Constantly jerking your entire head to the side a minumum of a couple of feet to register is insane. With the weight of the headset on this is just not comfortable enough to play for more than 10 minutes at a time. And of course the content is far to short for the price. In its current state of play and longevity, I would pay a couple dollars for this demo. Because yes its shorter than a demo being sold as a complete game. But be warned it is broken, and your neck will hate you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960513000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1481948962}
review:
God, what is wrong with these wimpy nerds playing this game? 

"The dodging system is broken, I have to waggle my head too much." ??? 
No, you just do a lunge to the side like the graphic shows you. Try moving your effing body instead of waggling your head (take a deep step to the left or right). Learn how to dodge -- it's very much like Mike Tyson's Punch-Out! Time your dodge to just before the attack hits.

I believe the complaints about the length of the game (haven't played it long enough to beat it yet), but this has been really fun for me.  I enjoyed the frantic gameplay in this game and it's one of the few that got me to knock over my computer. (A boss kept running to different spots past me, so I got very turned around and didn't have chaperone on high settings.) Yes, the voice acting is poor.

I enjoyed the upskirt moments, so thanks for that. I hope I can edit the Unreal assets to improve the 2nd stage. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198020307636', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1480192301}
review:
The production values are definitely there, the overall theme and graphics are spot on.
The magical sword and gun gameplay is well done and feels good.

So what's wrong? Well, within 20 minutes I was standing near the final boss, that is what's wrong.
This is not an early access game, so sheer lack of content at this price setting is way off.

I also don't like the dodging mechanic. It sounds cool on paper, but the practical implementation is not one where the game tracks your bodily movements, no, you have to shake your head brusquely for the dodge to register. You can imagine, given the fact that game is centered around the dodge system, this becomes a painful chore very quickly.

With the dodging system revised, at least 10 times the current content; this would be quite the game.
However having followed the developer news and comments, and lack of them, chances look slim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147435434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1486959781}
review:
I decided to drop some hefty coin for this game (considering many of the games I've purchased were half the price) with hopeful anticipation of a robust and immersive rpg experience, fighting along side an AI 'partner'.  And in some small way, it did hit it's mark. 

The game is pretty.  The characters are quite anime-ish; the girls touting some curves (though some of those curves are a bit blocky).  For those who might venture into the upskirt voyerism, I hear you won't be disappointed. What adolecent wouldn't be tempted to take a peek?

The backdrops are decent; I liked their look.  There was a little interaction with the characters, and for a moment or two, when you were prompted to interact, they would address you briefly.

The weapon concepts were rather nice.  The combination of sword and pistol were enjoyable, and I really liked using the pair.  The motlen blade and 'phoenix' attack was entertaining for a time. 

And that, unfortunately,  is all I have to say about this game that is in any way positive, and it pales in comparison to the fumbles and fails made and the outlandish pricing for perhaps an hour of content if you master the 'head jerk' dodge early on, which includes about 4 areas that you visit.  In reality, if you have this mastered, you could go through it in about 15 minutes.

The story has some potential, but the actual dialog was completely lacking, and though the story may have some creative possibilities, it literally consisests of a dozen or so lines.  The delivery by the characters is just as undeveloped.  The first few words from the whimsy (and almost whiney) voice our main heroine are delivered as she stands completely stationary, like an eye candy statue.  For a few lines she does appear to speak, though in true anime fashion her movments jerky and hardly match the dialog. Most times appearing to deliver her lines "telepathically" to you.

The first fights against ranged attacks you can't really dodge.  Or if you can, it has to be timed perfectly.  The first boss is rather impressive, and sets the tone for what could be a potentially interesting encounter, but the dodging is disorientating to say the least, and you have no idea why you are even fighting him.

The second scene looks promising at first, and even a bit risque, but completely falls flat.  The interaction is clunky and graphics are plagued with horrible clipping issues and are unrefined.

It just gets worse from there.  Battles are not very interactive, with the second boss running over top of you, dropping through the floor with massive clipping problems.  His attacks seem at times to be flung in your general direction, and if you don't flail back and forth widly to initiate the 'ninja dodge', expect to die quickly.  I really couldn't tell when I was dodging an attack, I just continually dodged in hopes I wouldn't be hit, which unfortunately worked.

You get a glimpse of your true foe after that, in a brief and completely confusing encounter, and the story just starts to fall apart from there. 

The next, and I assume, last battle (since I just got too tired of trying to constantly dodge over and over again randomly to hopes I would  miss the attacks flung at me), again, has no meaning at all.  You can see there was some thought put into the moment where it lined up with some story or concept that was supposed to go somewhere, but my only interest at that point was to finish so I wouldn't have to do it again.  

I wish I could say more positive things about this game.  I know the developers have put a lot of time and effort into it, but to put this out there as a fully realized game and to charge what they are charging is practically crimminal.  There is no possible way the content provided is worth even half of what they are charging, and I can't in good conscience recommend this game to anyone at this time.

I wish you guys the best, but you have a LONG way to go before this becomes an even somewhat polished experience. 

My suggestions:

Revamp the dodge experience.  Make it so you can actually dodge things, instead of hoping to trigger the 'blur' 

Write some story.  It's there somewhere, but you need to spend some time delivering it.  A short naration at each scene may help at the very least.

The concept of an AI partner is good.  Have them dialog.  People like to feel like they are engaged with the characters.  Give them some personality!  Don't RUSH the story along. 

The battles could be epic, but instead play out as just chaotic.  You need a better system of interaction with the characters while fighting.

More Rooms... actually allow the player to move around a bit in the world.  RPG is not just about a few boss battles.  It needs something more.

That's all I've got.  Good luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966247510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1479589954}
review:
Ay, caramba
https://youtu.be/yYKXIDErUEg

Bei diesem Spiel weiss ich nicht ob ich es empfehlen soll oder nicht.

Dieses Spiel hat so viel Potential aber macht so viel Frust.

Fürs erste Empfehle ich dieses Spiel, da ich denke, dass es noch besser wird.

Grafik: Die Grafik ist gut und die Levels sorgfältig erstellt.

Gameplay: Das Gameplay macht absolut Spass.
Allerdings hatte ich nach dem 3. Level das Gefühl, das ich in diesem Spiel nur 
gegen Endboss Gegner kämpfe. Einer schwieriger als der andere.

Steuerung: Die Steuerung ist für mich sehr schlecht.
Das Spiel ist wegen der schwierigen Gegnern sehr anstrengend zu spielen aber die Steuerung ist die Hölle.

Für fast alles benötigt man spezielle Bewegungen.
Diese Bewegungen in einem Kampf anzuwenden ist viel zu schwierig und funktionieren teilweise überhaupt nicht gut wenn man im Stress ist.
Man kommt auf jeden Fall ins Schwitzen und verliert gerne mal die Lust am Spielen.

Info an den Entwickler: Bitte mach das Spiel einfacher.
Die Waffe sollte wenn leer selbständig nachladen. Das manuelle Nachladen kann mit der bewegung gelöst werden.

Bitte bei den Endboss gegnern Hinweise über deren Schwachstellen einfügen. 
Evtl so wie bei „dreamcast, House of the dead 2“. Schau dir das mal an. 

Das ausweichen mit der Kopfbewegung ist unlogisch umgesetzt. Es entstehen ein paar 
wischende Streifen vor dem Gesicht, aber man bleibt an Ort und Stelle stehen. 
Ob mich der Gegner nun erwischt hat oder nicht, kann ich nicht wissen.


Pro: 
Viel Spass
Gute Grafik
Gutes Level Design
Musik
Endboss
Waffen

Kontra:
Preis zu teuer
Viel viel zu schwer!!!
Steuerung (Bewegungen) zu schwer.


------------------------------------------------------------
(google translate)


Ay, caramba

In this game I do not know if I should recommend it or not.

This game has so much potential but makes so much frustration.

For the first time, I recommend this game because I think it will be even better.

Graphics: The graphics are good and the levels carefully created.

Gameplay: The gameplay is absolutely fun.
However, I had the 3rd level feel I was in this game only
Against final boss fights. One more difficult than the other.

Control: The control is very bad for me.
The game is very hard to play because of the difficult opponents but the control is hell.

For almost everything you need special movements.
To use these moves in a fight is much too difficult and sometimes do not work well at all when you are in stress.
It is definitely a sweat and loses the pleasure of playing.

Info to the developer: Please make the game easier.
The gun should recharge when empty independently. The manual recharging can be released with the movement.

Please add hints about their weaknesses to the endboss.
Maybe as in "dreamcast, House of the dead 2". Look at this.

The evasion with the head movement is illogical. There are a few
Wiping strips in front of the face, but you remain standing in place.
Whether the opponent has caught me or not, I can not know.


Per:
Have fun
Good graphics
Good level design
music
Endboss
weapons

Contra:
Price too expensive
Much much too difficult !!!
Control (movements) too heavy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338552129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1491557957}
review:
基本システム 
１人称FPS 
　・３６０度見渡せるが基本的にその場からは移動不可 

 　・オーソドックスな銃と剣が攻撃手段、ラピッドショット、 
 　　剣のチャージショットみたいなものがある 
　　段数は無限、リロードにちょっと難あり 
　　他の攻撃手段は今のところ不明 
 　　剣で矢を弾いたりパリィは出来ない模様、今のところ剣はゴミ 

　・ミカっていう吸血鬼なんだか良く分からない女性キャラがお供 
 　　一応オートで戦ってはくれるが、とは言え攻撃にはほとんど 
　　期待できないので、基本的に自分で処理 
　　敵がそちらに寄って行かないのであくまで同行者的な扱い
　　放っておいても死ぬことはない

　・防御はその場で自分が勢いつけて体を振ることにより残像が 
　　発生して回避できるシステム 
　　一定時間の無敵あり？ 
 　　一応頭をぶんぶん振れば出来るけどめっちゃ疲れる 
　　連発不能なので同時に攻撃が重なってくると回避不能

　・ライフゲージがないため後どのぐらいまで耐えられるかが分からない
　　一定時間食らわなければオートで回復すると思われる
　　よって連続で食らわなければかなり長引く

 基本的な流れ 
　・面クリア型 
 　　一定時間雑魚が沸いてその後ボス戦の流れ 
　　ボスは今のところ異様に硬い上に回避不能っぽい攻撃が幾つか　 
　　具体的には１ボスの毒霧のような攻撃、回避しても判定が残っていて食らう時がある
　　２ボスの掴みも回避できない、剣を使うのだろうか？

 　・２ステクリアで武器を強化できる、って英語で表示されたけど 
　　その後いきなり３ステに入るので今のところはどういうシステム 
　　なのか良く分かりませんでした

グラと雰囲気は物凄い悪魔城っぽいゲーム 
 かなり影響を受けていると思われる、題材も吸血鬼ハンター？なので 
良くも悪くも普通のFPS、雰囲気が気に入ったなら買い 
今のところ損したとは思わないかな、しばらく遊びます
ただボリューム次第では×にするかもしれないｗ

チュートリアルで音楽が鳴らないのは仕様なのかな？
２ステ３ステとボス戦は鳴るから仕様かも知れないが違和感あり

author: {'steamid': '76561198224733352', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1479754782}
review:
very nice.

but need to be polished.

avoid system - ok. it's cool. but it is not perfect.
sometimes it don't work as i intended. 
need to be polished like increasing sensitivity when mobs attack or else way

graphic - nice. but physics could be better

music - more than average but need to be compressed 
and volume adjustment needed (little bit loud)

sound - sound effect is good. but 3d sound, i mean expression of 
stereo sound is really bad. it is not immersive. wherever character
is standing, it feels like they are whispering on my ears. no ambience
no correlations. it is very important for vr to express direction of sound
effect. sometimes sound direction is completely wrong.

gameplay - cool, it is very cool. but some actions need to be simplified.
i think action including gesture is not very good. because it sometimes 
don't work correctly depend on people. and when i slash skeletons, it
is not cool as slashing zombies. feedback and reaction of skeletons are
bit bland

in-game-design (art, fonts, interface design) - not bad. but feels like 
little bit dated. 

optimization - normal. at tutorial stage. it judders much. but after the stage
it works quite good.


SCORE

graphics - 7 
music - 6
sound effect - 4
gameplay - 8
expression - 6
optimization - 7

OVERALL - 7 ( good )


I really hesitate to recommend this game for this price.
but it has huge potential and i believe that devs have
good sense of game making. 
and they also promised bunch of free updates.

it is not perfect now. but it is fun anyway even though 
it has several problems. and i think it can be corrected soon.
so, i recommend this game when it is on discount.
